title: cryptown
author: cryptown
content: Hi everybody, I generated multiple address (1000 address for each coin: Bitcoin, Ethereum and Tron)by my seed via iancoleman.io and put it in my website that user can deposit crypto and that works fine. now i want to access my money through a wallet that support multiple address, I mean it should automatically scan first n addresses and show the balance in my wallet and i be able to spend money through wallet. So is there any wallet that have these feature?

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: For bitcoin, try Electrum and increase the gap limit is all I could think.The best is to go for is a payment processor like BTCPay: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5259548.0;topicseenPayment processor can handle the work and the stress for you.

comments.author: LDL
comments.body: Currently each Crypto wallet has added some unique features/Advantages.  A single wallet can be used on multiple platforms. Trust wallet, coinbase pro ,My Ethereum Wallet (MEW), tokenpocket(TP), electrum...can be used as multiple addresses...Trust wallet: support BTC, Ethereum, matic. Binance Smart chain..so many Tokenpocket (TP) : support bitcoin, Ethereum, matic, solana , BNB, Tether, etc...

comments.author: cryptown
comments.body: Thanks for reply.I have already checked trust wallet but it seems it does not support multiple address and does not show balance in all addresses except first address.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: I suggest you to use crypto payment processor, after few research I think this is a good solution for you SHKeeper open-source cryptocurrency payment processor, although it's new, but it's open source and support for multi cryptocurrency. The thing that I like in this payment processor is they're care with user privacy, they don't ask KYC and it's non custodial.Quote from: LDL on November 05, 2022, 10:37:35 AMA single wallet can be used on multiple platforms. Trust wallet, coinbase pro ,My Ethereum Wallet (MEW), tokenpocket(TP), electrum...can be used as multiple addresses...Don't suggest those terrible wallet, it's web based wallet and close source, so it's not secure to become a personal wallet that hold large amount coins.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: I think you can try looking at [List] Bitcoin Payment Processors.Payment processors will make your work more easily but with service fee if you use hosted payment processors. Fortunately, if you use self-hosted payment processors, no service fee.

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Quote from: cryptown on November 05, 2022, 10:08:52 AMHi everybody, I generated multiple address (1000 address for each coin: Bitcoin, Ethereum and Tron)by my seed via iancoleman.io and put it in my website that user can deposit crypto and that works fine. now i want to access my money through a wallet that support multiple address, I mean it should automatically scan first n addresses and show the balance in my wallet and i be able to spend money through wallet. So is there any wallet that have these feature? Coinomi does support bitcoin and the altcoins you mentioned.However  I wasn't able to find the option to scan for 1000 adresses.Have you considered using metamask and electrum?You can use different software for each coin, which is usually better.Hardware wallets such as ledger nano or trezor are also good options.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Try to manually import the seed phrases into each wallet for the respective coin.Electrum, for BTC. Metamask, for ETH. And the one for Tron.For Metamask or Tron, just import the seed, and then keep adding a new address(create account). On Electrum, import the seed and don't forget to use the BIP39 option. But do note that unless there is a better option, this way is surely a tedious way to handle such amount of addresses.

comments.author: Crypt0Gore
comments.body: I will like to warn you about Iancoleman, as a newbie I believe you can't handle that website, so do not store any large amount on the addresses you generated through the website to avoid stories that touches. With such large amount of addresses you can easily mess things up.How do you know about Iancoleman? I'm asking because you are a newbie.Do you know that it's not safe to type your recovery seed into any website online?The safest option I could think of is Metamask, you can generate many addresses using Metamask wallet.

The fact the he can understand the site seems he is knowledgeable enough.Well, i agree that the site might be compromised by any chance that's why most people recommends running Iancoleman offline.Now with the case of OP, electrum really will help just like what other recommends, but its only for bitcoin.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Meaning 3k addresses? too redundant and no one would risk importing that much in just one management account. iirc, Guarda wallet has what you're looking for but can't confirm if it's possible to import even just 100 addresses at a time per network.Not a recommendation, just DWYOR.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: cryptown on November 05, 2022, 10:08:52 AMI generated multiple address (1000 address for each coin: Bitcoin, Ethereum and Tron)by my seed via iancoleman.io and put it in my website that user can deposit crypto and that works fine. now i want to access my money through a wallet that support multiple address, I mean it should automatically scan first n addresses and show the balance in my wallet and i be able to spend money through wallet. So is there any wallet that have these feature? This is completely unrealistic use case to generate so many addresses for both Bitcoin with shitcoins and to expect some random wallet will be able to import thousands of addresses.Each wallet usually have limited number of addresses, so you would need to manually change and test that with each wallet, but if you used BIP39 format to generate seed words than it should work in theory.If you did this offline than your wallet should be safe, but don't import this anywhere if you did this while being online with your browser.Best way to have good open source wallet that supports all three of this coins (btc, eth, trx) is to use open source hardware wallets like Trezor with their Trezor Suite app, or maybe Keystone hardware wallet.

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: Quote from: cryptown on November 05, 2022, 11:05:37 AMThanks for reply.I have already checked trust wallet but it seems it does not support multiple address and does not show balance in all addresses except first address.No wallet is capable of producing so many addresses on different blockchain networks. At best cases, you will have to use more than one wallet, and this will make it difficult for you if this is to complete the transfers within the service you provide on your site.The safest solution is to purchase payment services from one of the well-known payment gateways that can facilitate the service for you and your customers as well. There are many of them and I can direct you to one of these two options: BitPay or NowPayments.

comments.author: cryptown
comments.body: Thanks for all reply, i know the consequences of using online address generator tool like 'iancoleman' and i did all proccess offline. After all, i decided to somehow implement my own wallet. it means that i will generate address myself in my own code (by help of exists repositories in github). and also implement spending coin procedure(signing the transactions) on my own so there is no need for wallet to support multiple address.
